items.sentence: I want to give Tom a present for his birthday.
You should read many books when you are young.
What makes you think I don't love you anymore?
I'll be offline until 2:30 tomorrow afternoon.
I know it's French, but I can't understand it.
I'd prefer study French with a native speaker.
I can't believe you're really in love with me.
I have no reason to believe that Tom is lying.
I'm pretty sure that I'll never see Tom again.
Do you think there's a chance you can do that?
This is the road that I was telling you about.
I didn't like the dress that Mary was wearing.
Tom texted Mary to tell her that he was sorry.
I know that this must be really scary for you.
Do I need to wear a helmet when driving a car?
I heard Tom and Mary would be going to Boston.
Tom came back from the store without anything.
Did you really think that I wouldn't tell Tom?
The plan will be brought into effect tomorrow.
The meeting was adjourned until the next week.
Our ultimate goal is to establish world peace.
The moment Tom was alone he opened the letter.
There's a post office in front of the station.
Millions of trees have been cut down for fuel.
A strange thing happened to me on my way here.
I bought this watch at a small shop in Boston.
I remember going to Boston when I was a child.
I inherited some silverware from my godmother.
The man aimed a weapon at the police officers.
The architect designed everything beautifully.
Tom didn't buy me lunch like he said he would.
Raised kerbs at bus stops should be mandatory.
I wonder why Tom was picked to be the manager.
Tom was sitting in the back of the auditorium.
A lot of plants in my garden seem to be dying.
I forgot that French was your native language.
Sometimes I wonder what you're thinking about.
Tom said that he needed to borrow an umbrella.
You seem to want the opposite of what we want.
Not all of the changes that Tom made were bad.
Tom and John exchanged jerseys after the game.
Tom is learning about his rights as a citizen.
Tom won't be the last one to leave the office.
Tom isn't a divorce lawyer. He's a tax lawyer.
We're going to leave as soon as it gets light.
The flight attendant asked me to change seats.
Tom was smoking a hand-rolled clove cigarette.
I took it for granted that Tom would be there.
I wonder what Tom did with the money he found.
Tom drank an entire bottle of vodka yesterday.
I'm warning you, Tom. My patience has a limit.
I already knew that Tom spoke French fluently.
Tom and Mary don't have to do that, but we do.
The tension between Tom and Mary was palpable.
I don't think that we'll get home before dark.
I thought Tom and Mary weren't dating anymore.
Don't listen to Tom. He's trying to trick you.
That isn't the only thing that I wanted to do.
Tom was hungry, so he made himself a sandwich.
Tom is the one who drove Mary to the hospital.
This isn't something that just anybody can do.
It's not difficult to see why people like Tom.
I don't want to spend any more time in Boston.
Tom asked his mother to buy him a new bicycle.
Tom will be visiting Mary in Boston next week.
Tomorrow morning Tom and I are leaving Boston.
It'll take us at least three weeks to do that.
It'll take me at least three weeks to do that.
I'm going to be out of town until next Monday.
I have a daughter who's married to a Canadian.
Tom came to the party with his new girlfriend.
Tom drew a picture of Mary and gave it to her.
Tom invited Mary and me to go skiing with him.
Tom only needs one computer, but he has three.
Tom plans to stay in Boston for several weeks.
Tom was desperate to do that, but Mary wasn't.
Are you sure that you want to throw that away?
Tom didn't know that Mary was a ballet dancer.
Let's wait until Tom leaves before we do that.
Tom didn't want to hurt his friend's feelings.
Do you think that Tom will ever do that again?
Tom plays the trumpet in the high school band.
I can't believe you did all this without help.
Are these the glasses you've been looking for?
Tom didn't know which option he should choose.
You haven't taken out the trash yet, have you?
I told Tom I didn't want to eat pizza tonight.
Tom did something he wasn't supposed to be do.
Tom and Mary are getting married next October.
I'm fed up with the way Tom has been behaving.
Tom's lack of interest in anything bothers me.
Tom admitted everything when I confronted him.
Tom began to notice that Mary was eating less.
My father is three years older than my mother.
This is the man who's suspected by the police.
This is the same type of car as my father has.
This is true of adults as well as of children.
This is the boy who showed me around the city.
This is the school where my father used to go.
Even if it rains, I'm still planning on going.
